# EKError.Code

**Enumeration**

Error codes for EventKit errors.

## Declaration

```swift
enum Code
```

## Constants

- **EKError.Code.eventNotMutable**: The event isn’t mutable and you can’t save or delete it.
- **EKError.Code.noCalendar**: The event isn’t associated with a calendar.
- **EKError.Code.noStartDate**: The event has no start date set.
- **EKError.Code.noEndDate**: The event has no end date set.
- **EKError.Code.datesInverted**: The event’s end date occurs before its start date.
- **EKError.Code.internalFailure**: An internal error occurred.
- **EKError.Code.calendarReadOnly**: The calendar is read-only and you can’t add events to it.
- **EKError.Code.durationGreaterThanRecurrence**: The duration of an event is greater than its recurrence interval.
- **EKError.Code.alarmGreaterThanRecurrence**: The alarm interval is greater than the recurrence interval.
- **EKError.Code.startDateTooFarInFuture**: The start date is further into the future than the calendar can display.
- **EKError.Code.startDateCollidesWithOtherOccurrence**: The event’s start date collides with another occurrence of the event.
- **EKError.Code.objectBelongsToDifferentStore**: The object belongs to a different calendar store.
- **EKError.Code.invitesCannotBeMoved**: You can’t move the event because it’s an invitation.
- **EKError.Code.invalidSpan**: The system encountered an invalid span during a save or deletion.
- **EKError.Code.calendarHasNoSource**: You can’t save the calendar without setting a source first.
- **EKError.Code.calendarSourceCannotBeModified**: You can’t move the calendar to another source.
- **EKError.Code.calendarIsImmutable**: The calendar is immutable and you can’t modify or delete it.
- **EKError.Code.sourceDoesNotAllowCalendarAddDelete**: The source doesn’t allow you to add or delete calendars.
- **EKError.Code.recurringReminderRequiresDueDate**: The recurring reminder requires a due date.
- **EKError.Code.structuredLocationsNotSupported**: The source to which this calendar belongs doesn’t support structured locations.
- **EKError.Code.reminderLocationsNotSupported**: The source doesn’t support locations on reminders.
- **EKError.Code.alarmProximityNotSupported**: The source doesn’t allow geofences on alarms.
- **EKError.Code.calendarDoesNotAllowEvents**: The calendar doesn’t allow you to add events.
- **EKError.Code.calendarDoesNotAllowReminders**: The calendar doesn’t allow you to add reminders.
- **EKError.Code.sourceDoesNotAllowReminders**: The source doesn’t allow calendars supporting reminder entity types.
- **EKError.Code.sourceDoesNotAllowEvents**: The source doesn’t allow calendars supporting event entity types.
- **EKError.Code.priorityIsInvalid**: The priority number for the reminder is invalid.
- **EKError.Code.invalidEntityType**: The entity type is invalid.
- **EKError.Code.procedureAlarmsNotMutable**: You can’t create or modify procedure alarms.
- **EKError.Code.eventStoreNotAuthorized**: The user hasn’t authorized your app to access events or reminders.
- **EKError.Code.osNotSupported**: The action isn’t supported on the current operating system.
- **EKError.Code.invalidInviteReplyCalendar**: The calendar is invalid or nil.
- **EKError.Code.notificationsCollectionFlagNotSet**: The notification collection doesn’t have the notifications collection flag.
- **EKError.Code.sourceMismatch**: The object’s source doesn’t match its container’s source.
- **EKError.Code.notificationCollectionMismatch**: The notification collection that contains this notification doesn’t match the collection the system is trying to save.
- **EKError.Code.notificationSavedWithoutCollection**: The notification can’t save because you haven’t added it to a notification collection and saved the collection first.
- **EKError.Code.last**: This error is for internal use.

## Enumeration Cases

- **EKError.Code.reminderAlarmContainsEmailOrUrl**

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Errors

- **EKError**: An EventKit error.
- **EKErrorDomain**: A string that identifies the EventKit error domain.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
